intro: Seseli gouanii, commonly known as the Gouan's seseli, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seseli gouanii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
